result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven F Owens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: $250 fine plus costs on Ct. 2.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

To pay the costs of the action on Ct. 1.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. No contact with the victim, L.C. Not to enter any bars or taverns.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: 60 DAYS STAYED. To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. Huber release granted. 60 days to report.
To perform 20 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

and stipulation to waive appearance and hearing
from DOC Agent Amy Thompson with petition to convert fine/costs owing to civil judgment.

ADA Nicholas Grode appeared in person. Probation Agent Amy Thompson appears by phone. Defendant Steven F. Owens appeared by phone.   Defendant being discharged on May 17th, he needs to set up payment plan and follow through with payments or it will be converted to a civil judgment.  Probation Agent will prepare order.
from DOC Agent Amy Thompson re: how much defendant has paid toward financial obligations. File. DTE
Subpoena and Proof of Service Amy Thompson

Defendant Steven F Owens in court.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DOC Jordan Kubicki appears by phone for Agent Amy Thompson.  Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. Court questions defendant on why he's not made any payments toward his financial obligations.  Defendant explains he's had some tough times in the last year, indicates he made a $1,000 payment today and a $50 payment last week.  State would like to see restutition paid before defendant being discharged from probation, requests another PRH before defendants scheduled discharge date.  Court sets another PRH, indicates defendant and probation agent can appear by phone for next hearing.  Probation review hearing scheduled for May 4, 2018 at 03:00 pm.
from DOC Agent Amy Thompson with information for upcoming probation review hearing.   File. DTE
Subpoena for Agent Amy  Thompson
Probation review hearing on March 22, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Steven F Owens in court with attorney David R. Clowers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1 & 2. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 2.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.  State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI.  State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Defendant apologizes to the court.  Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Steven F Owens in court with attorney David R. Clowers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, indicates this matter is now in the #1 position for trial. Atty Clowers indicates matter is proceeding to trial at this point. Court would like to know by noon on Friday, May 20 if defendants position changes.  Bond remains in effect.
emails between VWC Lisa Mraz and Officers Markus Tassoul and Chad Mielke.
Jury trial at 05-24-2016 08:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 04-15-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Steven F Owens in court with attorney David R. Clowers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, indicates this matter is still in the #2 position for trial.  Atty Clowers has a possible conflict with the jury date. State indicates one of their witnesses is not available on December 1, requests to reschedule trial. Atty Clowers joins in the request.   Court grants request to reschedule trial.  State to let JA know availability of witness before she sets trial date. Bond remains in effect.

Pre-trial conference at 11-05-2015 08:30 am.
Jury trial at 12-01-2015 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven F Owens in court with attorney David R. Clowers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Clowers indicates matter is not resolved, asks court to set matter for pretrial and trial. Set for pretrial and trial (not Oct. 11-14). Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Steven F Owens in court with attorney David R. Clowers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Clowers indicates his investigation is complete but he does not have the report yet. Atty Clowers requests another status in 30 days to allow him time to review report and decide how they wish to proceed. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Defense Discovery Demand

Defendant Steven F Owens in court with attorney David R. Clowers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Clowers indicates has been investigating a potential defense to defendants case. Atty Clowers requests another status in 30 days. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
from Atty Clowers asking to reschedule 6/08/15 hearing because of a conflict. Court reschedules.
Status conference at 06-22-2015 09:45 am
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Steven F Owens in court with attorney David R. Clowers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.   Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Steven F Owens in court with attorney David R. Clowers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limits for prelim.  Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

No contact direct or indirect with L.C.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center. Not to enter any bars or taverns.
